content.prompt: Which of the following best explains why Marshallâ€™s plan outlined in the passage was a break from prior United States policy in Europe?

choices.label: The United States had provided loans to European states after the First World War in the Dawes plan.
The United States had adopted a largely isolationist foreign policy with regard to Europe after the First World War.
The United States had been critical of the mandate system implemented by the Allies after the First World War.
The United States had been hostile toward the communist regime established by the Bolshevik Revolution.

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Explain how a specific historical development or process is situated within a broader historical context.
